adrFormatAddress: 476 Broome St, New York, NY 10013, USA

originalText.text: Like all the girls who love French dresses, I was so excited when I purchase my first dress from Rouje. However, their quality is not worth the value at all! The stripe shelled off after the first wash (I followed the wash guidance) and I reached out to the brand, they just denied their quality issue. Now I know the store and products are just cute on the surface. Their quality and service don’t match their price tag at all!!! Girls, save your $$ for a better brand!

text.text: Like all the girls who love French dresses, I was so excited when I purchase my first dress from Rouje. However, their quality is not worth the value at all! Now I know the store and products are just cute on the surface. Their quality and service don’t match their price tag at all!!! Girls, save your $$ for a better brand!

originalText.text: What a wonderful experience in this store. I came from Rhode Island and knew that I had to stop at Rouje to see a store in-person for the first time. I’m not a city person, but found my way on the subway, and the trip was absolutely worth it. The store was beautifully merchandised, which I can appreciate, being a merchandiser myself. The 2 associates were so helpful and patient as I tried on multiple different pieces. I decided on the Laly dress, and the associate who rang me out was so kind and included a gift with my purchase. She also made sure that my online account was linked to my in-store purchase. Overall I had a lovely experience and I would return to NYC again just to visit this store. Next up - Paris!

originalText.text: I had the pleasure of visiting Rouje in NYC after experiencing their stores in Paris, and I must say, it's a truly exceptional experience. The store director exuded elegance and warmth, introducing me to the brand with grace. The entire team was incredibly helpful and friendly, always there when you needed assistance and styling advice with their amazing products. Rouje NYC has quickly become my number one Parisian store in the city.

text.text: I had the pleasure of visiting Rouje in NYC after experiencing their stores in Paris, and I must say, it's a truly exceptional experience. originalText.text: I do like the clothes and the people who work the store are friendly. However, the miscommunication between the store and the headquarter makes me not trust this brand’s customer service at all. Hopefully, I never have to test it, since I have purchased some clothes from them. The representatives from the headquarters were telling me one thing, then I go to the store and they tell me that what I was told was wrong. It’s such a small team, you would think they would have better communication.    If you want to buy something with them, I would think very carefully about it as they have no refunds, only exchanges or store credit. Store credit is literally just for the storefront, not the wider online store.

originalText.text: I just visited and had the best time. I was so happy to see that there was a NYC location. The sales associate was so helpful, and I was very pleased with the service. I would recommend shopping here during the week to avoid the busyness of the weekend.
